    • Method Detail

      • readNoteAndAddToBuilder

        protected void readNoteAndAddToBuilder(java.lang.String line,
                                       MidiNoteSequenceBuilder builder)
                                throws MusicException
        Description copied from class: MidiNoteSequenceReader
        Reads a Note from the provided line and adds it to the builder.
        A note line must have one of the following formats:
        1. N;String;String
        2. N;String;String;Number

        The N; must always be present,
        the first String contains the actual note e.g. C#5,
        the second String always contains a NoteValue String @see NoteValue.
        the Number after the NoteValue is optional and denotes the the number of dots behind the note value.
        Also have a look at MidiNoteSequenceBuilder.appendNote(String, NoteValue) , MidiNoteSequenceBuilder.appendNote(String, NoteValue, int)
        To convert a String to a NoteValue the NoteValue.valueOf(String) function can be used.
        Specified by:
        readNoteAndAddToBuilder in class MidiNoteSequenceReader
        Parameters:
        line - a NoteSequenceline
        Throws:
        MusicException

      • readCordAndAddToBuilder

        protected void readCordAndAddToBuilder(java.lang.String line,
                                       MidiNoteSequenceBuilder builder)
                                throws MusicException
        Description copied from class: MidiNoteSequenceReader
        Reads a Chord from the provided line and adds it to the builder.
        A Chord line must have one of the following formats:
        1. C;String;String
        2. C;String;Number
        The C; must always be present, the first String always contains one ore more Notes that make up a Chord @see Chord.Chord(String).
        The second String of the 1. format contains a NoteValue String @see NoteValue. The number of the 2. format contains a value denoting the length of the tone as a fraction of a whole (@see Double).
        Also have a look at MidiNoteSequenceBuilder.appendChord(Chord, NoteValue) and MidiNoteSequenceBuilder.appendChord(String, double).
        Specified by:
        readCordAndAddToBuilder in class MidiNoteSequenceReader
        Throws:
        MusicException

      • readHeader

        protected MidiNoteSequenceBuilder readHeader(java.lang.String header)
                                      throws MusicException
        Description copied from class: MidiNoteSequenceReader
        This method reads the header of the provided file (the first line of the .sequence file) and creates a MidiNoteSequenceBuilder from it.
        This line must meet the following format:
        !Number;Number;String
        The first number of the header line contains the Channel ID, the second the volume.
        The String of the header line represents the Instrument. @see Instruments.
        The Instrument String can be processed using the Instruments.parseInstrument(String) Methode.
        This method throws a MusicException if volume or channel do not meet the following requirements:
        - chanel and volume must be positive
        - volume can only be in the interval of [0,127]
        - channel can only be between 0 and 15
        This method should use the {@link Instruments.Guitars#Acoustic_Guitar_nylon, if the Instrument can not be parsed corrently.
        Specified by:
        readHeader in class MidiNoteSequenceReader
        Parameters:
        header - the first line of the .sequence file
        Returns:
        Throws:
        MusicException
